author: Taking My Business Elsewhere
title: So Secure I Can’t Even View My Statement
review:
I can’t view my statements anymore because it’s asking for the security code off my statement, which I don’t know because it’s on my statement. So in order to view my statement I need to have my statement available to get the code off of it. 
This is ridiculous. Please find another means to verify identity rather than this poor method. This is an internet bill not a bank account, a simple email or text message is more than enough to verify my identity for the account. 
Please fix it.

author: Spectrumvirus
title: Watch for deceiving reps.
review:
Don’t appreciate my billing statement showing a current balance of 263.and cents when my payment is $250.01 had to call in to verify and make sure there is no current balance due. Which your rep verified and gave me the correct payment due of $250.01. Although my screen still show a current balance of $263 and cents even after the new update for your app was made on my phone. Please review my account because I know I have requested to have my billing statement to state a due amount on the 19th because was when I started business with you and my disability check comes in in the middle of the month. So as it does look that I am paying late. I was told it wouldn’t effect me. But it does on my credit score. Why can’t you all comply with me? 
Respectfully 
Maria Rosalinda Benavidez

author: bertmister
title: Lost Services
review:
Fioptics put service into our area a while back. One of the decisions to stay with TWC was our ability to program our DVR remotely on our phones. When you don’t make it home in time to catch the show you want to watch or you forget to record it before you leave it is a HUGE plus to be able to get on the app and record. 
At the time I was with Verizon and have switched to Spectrum. It still doesn’t work.  One step forward two steps back. I hope Spectrum can fix this.

author: XYZKeith
title: Consistent Outages
review: I moved to a new home in O’Fallon Missouri, and start at my spectrum services here. Since moving in there are daily outages. I work from home and have to use my hotspot more than 50% of the time daily. Two technicians have been out, and one change the modem. This morning I get out to find that there is an outage in my area again! please fix this problem. I would expect my bill should be less than it is, as I have had less service, but I am paying the full price.

author: Hokie fan
title: Router
review: I have purchased and tried 4 different routers in the past month. They worked for a little while, but then did not. Spoke with each of the router company’s customer support and never could get them to work consistently. I called Spectrum today and decided to try their router. I picked the equipment in their store, came home installed it, called Spectrum to connect it . . . Voila, it works perfectly and all my direct wired computers are screaming fast. That you Spectrum!

I picked the equipment in their store, came home installed it, called Spectrum to connect it . . . Voila, it works perfectly and all my direct wired computers are screaming fast. That you Spectrum!

author: Alice83
title: A shoddy app from a horrible ISP
review: Spectrum, née TWC, is an awful company that actively spends the money we pay them to lobby for consumer and internet hostile policies. Their antipathy towards their customers is evident across this app. There is no working copy/paste or autofill for entering payment details (so you’ll need to hand type all your credit card information) and the lack of Apple Pay and other payment options shows how little they care. The “Spectrum WiFi” profile installation process is broken as well (tested on both iPhone and iPad). The only things working fully seem to be the self service support features (which reduces Spectrum’s phone support costs). In summary, this app is focused on saving Spectrum’s time/money, not yours.
original_title: A shoddy app from a horrible ISP
original_review: Spectrum, née TWC, is an awful company that actively spends the money we pay them to lobby for consumer and internet hostile policies. Their antipathy towards their customers is evident across this app. There is no working copy/paste or autofill for entering payment details (so you’ll need to hand type all your credit card information) and the lack of Apple Pay and other payment options shows how little they care. The “Spectrum WiFi” profile installation process is broken as well (tested on both iPhone and iPad). The only things working fully seem to be the self service support features (which reduces Spectrum’s phone support costs). In summary, this app is focused on saving Spectrum’s time/money, not yours.

author: wammsy
title: Great App, unreliable Service
review:
Their app is sleek and is great! However living in the Dallas-Fort Worth Area ought to have better service.
This reliability of Spectrums internet service is not conducive to working from home or hybrid work. 
Monthly subscriptions should be prorated and the bill should be proportional to the amount of internet uptime. If the bill is $60 for a month with thirty days and I have a total downtime of 24 hours of internet downtime then the bill should only be $58.
Despite great customer service, I will be subscribing to another more reliable provider when we move.

author: kay_z28
title: App doesn’t load.
review: The app essentially never works for me. Whether I’m on cellular data or the Spectrum wifi. Even when I have it completely up to date, my app never loads. I have deleted it and redownloaded as well.

author: Grace RodBal.
title: Disappointed
review: I’ve requested a paper bill. Automated messages ask for my security code. I need my statement. If I can’t get a printed statement with my security code, I will cancel services. Why is so difficult to get a paper bill???????

author: Kevinobz
title: Review
review: We were debating on moving our internet services to ATT due to the constant outages. However, you guys continue to provide excellence with your customer support, technicians and your locked in prices. That’s not something I believe ATT can offer. Anytime we have ever had an issue Spectrum has responded quickly.
original_review: We were debating on moving our internet services to ATT due to the constant outages. However, you guys continue to provide excellence with your customer support, technicians and your locked in prices. That’s not something I believe ATT can offer. Anytime we have ever had an issue Spectrum has responded quickly.
